name: wiki-js
description: Wiki.js is a modern, self-hosted wiki platform with a rich editor, authentication, search, and versioning. It supports multiple backends, integrations, and themes, and can be self-hosted or used via commercial cloud hosting.
features: Rich editor: Create content with a powerful WYSIWYG editor, markdown, or code editor based on preference.
Authentication options: Support multiple authentication methods including LDAP, OAuth, SAML, and local accounts.
Search engine: Find content instantly with powerful full-text search powered by Elasticsearch or database search.
Version control: Track all page changes with Git integration for complete revision history and rollback capability.
Multi-language: Create content in multiple languages with automatic language detection and switching.
Asset management: Upload and organize images, documents, and media files with a built-in asset manager.
Access control: Define granular permissions controlling who can read, write, or manage specific pages or sections.
Themes and customization: Choose from multiple themes or create custom designs to match your brand.
API access: Integrate with other systems using the GraphQL API for automation and custom integrations.
Storage backends: Store content in PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, or SQL Server based on your infrastructure.
Module system: Extend functionality with authentication modules, storage engines, and rendering engines.
Analytics integration: Track page views and user engagement with built-in analytics or external services.
